author: Mark Jones
title: Jose Mourinho refuses to name his best ever XI - so we've done it for him
text:
Who'll make Jose's best ever XI? And will you agree with it? (probably not) (Photo: Man Utd/Real Madrid/Getty) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
When Jose Mourinho was asked to name an XI of the best players he's managed over his long, successful career he gave a very Jose Mourinho answer. Or rather no answer. 
"It’s an answer that I’ve always refused to give and will continue to," he told an interview with the FIFA website. 
"So many players gave their blood and soul when they played for me, how can I name some and forget others?" 
Fair enough, then, but where's the fun in that? "Nope, not doing it" (Photo: Reuters) 
No, it is far better to squabble and argue over these things until everyone is blue in the face, and we're more than happy to give you the opportunity to do that. 
So, here it is. The best XI that Jose Mourinho has managed. 
Feel free to disagree. Goalkeeper: Petr Cech Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, it's Mourinho's reliable Chelsea stopper (Photo: AFP/Getty) Right-back: Javier Zanetti What a player the Inter stalwart was, and he could play anywhere! (Photo: Getty) Centre-back: Ricardo Carvalho A stalwart for Mourinho at Porto and Chelsea, what a defender Carvalho was (Photo: Getty) Centre-back: John Terry Jose's 'Captain, Leader, Legend' takes one of the centre-back spots Left-back: Marcelo A close call, but the Brazilian edges it thanks to his improvement under Mourinho at Real Madrid (Photo: David Ramos) Defensive midfield: Claude Makelele How could you leave out a player who had a role named after him? (Photo: Action Images) Centre midfield: Wesley Sneijder So much competition again, but it is easy to forget how good the Dutchman was when Inter won the Champions League in 2010 Centre midfield: Frank Lampard It had to be, didn't it? Super Frank gets in Jose's team (Photo: Getty) Forward: Cristiano Ronaldo Just the 168 goals for Ronaldo during his three seasons under Mourinho. Yep. Forward: Didier Drogba The Ivorian became unplayable under Mourinho at Chelsea (Photo: Getty) Forward: Zlatan Ibrahimovic After a prolific season together at Inter, the pair are now back together at Manchester United (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) Not bad, huh? But if you disagree - and you almost certainly will - then leave your XIs below. We're waiting.
